SEARCH
Package fang2.transformers

Class KeyboardTransformer

java.lang.Object
fang2.core.TransformerAdapter
fang2.transformers.KeyboardTransformer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transformer
public class KeyboardTransformer extends TransformerAdapter
Decorate a TransformerAdapter so that it runs forward or backward for any frame only when appropriate keys are pressed.

When a key in the plusKeys collection is pressed, then the controlled TransformerAdapter is called with a positive time step; when a key in the minusKeys collection is pressed, then the controlled TransformerAdapter is called with an inverted, negative time step.

This is an example of the decorator pattern: this is a TransformerAdapter which includes, as part of itself, a TransformerAdapter which is decorated or filtered by this transformer.

    • KeyboardTransformer

      Create a new KeyboardTransformer controlling the given TransformerAdapter using the given player's keyboard activity.
      Parameters:
      transformer - the transformer driven by the plus/minus keys under this keyboard
      playerNubmer - which player's keyboard is used to drive the transformer

    • advance

      public void advance(double dT)
      Advance one time step.

      Check the key pressed status. If a plusKeys has been pressed, then call the advance method of transform with dT. If a minusKeys has been pressed, then call the advance method of the transform with -dT (negative time!).

      Specified by:
      advance in interface Transformer
      Overrides:
      advance in class TransformerAdapter
      Parameters:
      dT - the time elapsed since the last call to advance

    • getMinusKeys

      public String getMinusKeys()
      Get the collection of minus keys.
      Returns:
      a string with all the characters used for the minus keys, for calling the transform in a backward direction

    • getPlayerNumber

      public int getPlayerNumber()
      Get the player number for whom this transformer is installed.
      Returns:
      player number for this object.

    • getPlusKeys

      public String getPlusKeys()
      Get the collection of plus keys.
      Returns:
      a string with all the characters used for the plus keys, for calling the transform in a forward direction

    • nonMaskableAdvance

      public void nonMaskableAdvance(double dT)
      Make sure the non-maskable advance method of any wrapped (decorated) transformer is called. Required for damping and similar "after update delta" effects.
      Specified by:
      nonMaskableAdvance in interface Transformer
      Overrides:
      nonMaskableAdvance in class TransformerAdapter
      Parameters:
      dT - time since last advance
